item.title: About Me
item.description: Dallin started teaching himself how to program in C++ at 12-years old, driven by his fascination with the inner workings of the computer. He then proceded to learn everything he could about different ways of programmming: extensively investigating the Lisp and Forth families of languages, reading about Smalltalk and haskell. He began to be curious about more than just application programming and began investigating different operating systems: the Lisp machine OS Genera, Chuck Moore’s Forth system, and Plan9 from Bell Labs, among others.

item.title: Reading Material
item.description: Currently Reading: Communicating Sequential Processes — C.A.R Hoare Have Read, Would Recommend: Let Over Lambda — Doug Hoyte Introduction to Lambda Calculus — H. Barendregt & E. Barendsen On Lisp — Paul Graham Recursive Functions of Symbolic Expressionsand Their Computation by Machine, Part I — John McCarthy The Hundred Year Language — Paul Graham Forth: The Early Years — Charles (Chuck) Moore Forth – A Language for Interactive Computing (pdf) — Charles (Chuck) Moore & Geoffrey Leach Regular Expression Matching Can Be Simple And Fast — Russ Cox Notes on Programming in C — Rob Pike Plan 9 — Rob Pike et al.
